intro: Glottiphyllum neilii, commonly known as the Neil's glottiphyllum, is a rare and striking member of the Mesembryanthemaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It has a compact growth habit, often forming a dense rosette of foliage. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
